attributes.action: Fuel dropped to 2004 price (80p) Reduce price and amount of tax quicker!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/update/2013-05-15/breakdown-of-the-petrol-price-at-uk-pumps/

If price of fuel is reduced this has an impact of the cost of living to family's as therefore helping recude bills. Saving money for small business as fuel bills are a key concern. This would also have an impact of public transport that is fuel based making this cheaper. This would also therefore put more pressure on the usage of rail being impacted with the cost of electiricity making them compete value 4 mone
attributes.background: Fuel in 2004 was 80p per litre and 59p was tax. The fuel duty between 04 and now has increased reducing the margin for fuel company's and therefore they are reducing prices slower. As per the RAC comments the fuel company's should be passing of benefits quicker but also tax should be reviewed.
